Pre-Game Insights: Memories of the 2016 T20 World Cup match between India and Bangladesh add an edge to the contest.
Rain could potentially affect the match.
India faced issues against South Africa, particularly with their top order and bowling in the latter overs.
Bangladesh's standout performer Taskin Ahmed has taken eight wickets in the Super 12s.
Najmul Hossain Shanto made a career-best 71 against Zimbabwe.
Bangladesh is still in contention for the semi-finals following their dramatic win against Zimbabwe.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Adelaide Oval is traditionally a high-scoring ground, particularly under lights.
This is the first T20I between India and Bangladesh since their bilateral series three years ago.
India have won their only T20I at the Adelaide Oval, beating Australia by 37 runs in 2016.
Bangladesh have also won their only international match at the Adelaide Oval, a 15-run win over England in the 2015 World Cup.
Suryakumar Yadav is on 935 runs in 2022 and is set to become the second men's batter to get 1000-plus runs in a calendar year.
Others: Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan acknowledged that India is the favorite team and that a win against India would be considered an upset.
